frontmatter.name: Dashkevich Lev Urbanovich

activity.description: From 1911 he began to publish in scientific journals (La Nature. Paris)
In 1911-1920 he lived in the Caucasus, worked as a teacher of French, physics, natural science and other subjects in the gymnasiums of Eryvani (Yerevan)
At the end of May 1920, he returned to Minsk. Since October 1920, the reader lectures on world literature and photography at the Minsk Institute of National Education
In 1921 he worked in the Scientific Terminology Commission of the People's Commissariat of Education of the BSSR (natural section)
In May-June 1923, he participated in an ethnographic expedition in Igumensk and Borisov Counties
In 1923-1924, a science photographer at the medical faculty of BSU
In 1930 he began working in the Minsk House of Technology, at the geographical faculty of the Belarusian State University

In 1941-1944 he lived in an evacuation in Frunze (now Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan), worked in medical institutions. In September 1944 he returned to Minsk. He worked at the Institute of Theoretical Medicine and the Institute of Physiology

frontmatter.science: Belarusian photographer, publicist, teacher, scientist, inventor

exhibitions.name: Ethnographic expedition in the Igumen and Logoisk regions
